Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel, but you could do worse”
Reviews.Author: GoPackers12
Reviews.Content: First off, my double room did not have queen beds, as advertised, they are full size. Also, they are spring mattresses, and fairly uncomfortable. I had very poor wireless internet in my room, (kept getting kicked off) which was at the end of one of the wings. Staff was friendly and helpful, as far as they could be. Hard to recommend this place without better beds and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points by Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Btown007
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel. Dining options were ok. Menu could be a little more expansive in the evening. Breakfast buffet was decent for what it was. Service was very attentive. About the only issue I had with the hotel was the bed. Very hard compared to other Sheraton's I have stayed at. Usually Sheraton's have the best beds that I have ever slept in. Not this one. Room was plenty big and had nice area to get work done if need be. Bar area was nice and drinks were good. There was an older gentleman who came around offering free cigars which was a nice touch, even if I didn't take one. Close to a couple freeways as well as other dining options. Overall, a nice quiet place. I think there was a small par three golf course on site as well, but I didn't check that out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lena195otto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip and was very positive impressed by its surroundings, with nice and relaxing landscapes. Room adequate to the standard. Personnel at reception professional and always helpful, and good shuttle service. What I liked less is the unreliable slow internet connection, which could be improved a little and, the morning breakfast that was a bit messy, followed up sometimes by a rude personnel with problem with english comprehension.

Reviews.Title: “Internet doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: Sometimes, I feel like a stuck record. But gadzooks! Seriously, how hard can it be, in the year 2012, for Sheraton to build hotels with fast, reliable Internet? That's twice in two months they've managed to ruin a business trip. Aside from that, this place is OK. Has all the ambience of a motorway service station, mind, but rooms are cheap and Fine and the staff perfectly cheerful. Just don't plan on using your computer here

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay in this area - then this hotel is a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: Charrie63
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th stay at Four Points and probably the one I enjoyed the most. I come here twice a year for business. Off of the top of my head what I like the most is: Free and safe parking Clean microwave and frig in the room Huge flat screen television - but not enough channels at all. Food Network though. Fantastic memory foam bed - at least I think that's what it's make of. They do have a coffee pot in the room with a good assortment of coffee and teas, they are wonderful enough to include liquid creamer. When I first began staying here the mugs were ceramic and I loved it - now they are paper. They don't have central heat or air conditioning - it is the machine that attaches to the window - but, I've never minded this because I love the hum of those machines, they tend to drown out any background noise. Cleaning crew is really good, front staff have never left me hanging, I even like the coffee lady in the lobby. I've never had an issue with anyone who works there. There are times when I need a late check out and they do their best to accommodate me. I love to take a walk around the hotel every day at the lunch break, there are nice chairs to sit in around the property where you can watch the golfers do their thing. The negative stuff is small: Top complaint is the connecting door between rooms - there is an inch of air space under the door and you can hear every shuffle of your neighbors feet as they scuffle across the room. This gap is also present under the front door which doesn't help in keeping any hallway noise out so I take a towel from the bathroom and block the gap up when it's time to hit the sack. Also, I have not had much luck getting rooms with bathtubs with drains that plug. I need to plug the drain with a washcloth in order to take a bath as opposed to a shower. They have great water temperatures - if you want hot water, they have it. My last complaint is the taste of the water. They provide you with one free bottle of water on the day that you check in, but that is it. The water out of the faucet is very very bad. That's it with the negative side. My room has always had internet. A few years back you needed to go to the front dest for an ethernet cord - but now you just sign on through the hotel's site. It was free. Now, as far as what to do. If you came without a car you will get your daily exercise in :) Head out of the hotel and go right on Aero Drive, when you get to Conroy make a right. This street has tons of food places (this is mainly an Asian area so that plays out in the food choices) as well as drug stores like CVS. Probably a 15 minute light walk each way. If you drove, head out of the hotel to the left and go about two miles, stay in the right lane. When you see the McDonalds turn right (This is the light before the freeway) On that stretch there is a WalMart and Frys Electronics among other places. Take note that they just put in traffic cameras at that big intersection - the camera flashes go off like mad - so follow the rules and save your money :) Twice in past visits I opted to stay at different hotels that were cheaper and closer to places to eat. I was sorry I did it. Now I just book this place as far in advance as I can. This visit was $99 per day mid-week. My summer visits are about $135. Like I stated in the title of this review - if you need to stay in this exact area then this is the best hotel you have to choose from. If you can push it to Mission Valley you can get a nicer room for less and be in the middle of everything - but that all depends on how you want to work it. All the best and I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “No heated pool or spa, slow Internet, no charm”
Reviews.Author: lt3333
Reviews.Content: Despite saying on their website that they had a heated pool and spa -- it wasn't. Since I was travelling on business but brought my family with me, I specifically looked for a hotel with a heated pool to occupy them. Also, there is nothing near this hotel within walking distance, so if I took the car, they were stuck there and had to buy hotel food. Also, while they had a business center, it was closed during my trip. Internet access in room was slow, and too slow to upload attachments. Beds were mediocre. Staff was unhelpful -- often not available or slow to respond and without solutions. Lots of little things, like the people who cleaned the room did not restock the coffee pods, so we had to get more from the front desk. Instead of coming up at 7pm when we called, they came up and knocked on the door at 9pm when we were all asleep (we had come from the East Coast so this was late for us). When we said the hot tub was not hot, the front desk said they would call when it was up and running, but they never did. The hotel lacked all charm -- inside it felt like a warehouse. I was extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much...”
Reviews.Author: Cailin O
Reviews.Content: Despite the claims on their Web site, there is no WiFi in the rooms - only ethernet and that is unreliable. Staff are barely cordial - not overtly rude, just to the point where you know you are not being treated well, but can't complain because there is no particular stand out behavior you can point to. Rooms are okay, reasonably clean. But who cares when you have work to do and can't get online.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience, good staff and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Rosanna D
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business: I was on my own and I had the chance to experience the restaurant as well: good food better than in other hotel with more known chef and at a reasonable price. Rooms quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Keyword: "stingy"”
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: The room was fine. Clean, reasonably updated, comfortable bed, quiet. They were, however, unusually stingy in their advertised amenities. For 2 adults in the room, they provided: * 2 bath towels * 1 hand towel * 1 bar of soap for a 3-day stay * 1 coffee cup per day * 1 packet of coffee per day * 1 bottled water for a 3-day stay My sister and her husband, staying in a separate room from us, had the same experience. The breakfast bar was poorly stocked. The pastries were many-days old, and they had none of the advertised yogurt throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RosaHermosa
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton San Diego is a wonderful hotel. The hotel and rooms are very clean and nice. The hotel staff are very nice and friendly. Matt from the front desk was super friendly and nice and check in was quick.....Thank You Four Points San Diego for making my stay so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff made it okay.”
Reviews.Author: jinphil_cho
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for some meetings and stayed one night at the Four Points. I called the shuttle when I touched down at SAN and the driver swung by to pick me up in about 15 minutes. When I got to the hotel, I was rather underwhelmed at the interior. It felt like someone took out all the furniture. I went into my SPG room and while it was very spacious I still got the same empty feeling as the foyer and the outside halls. The whole place feels almost like an aeroplane hangar rather than a hotel, but I'll concede it is a Four Points so you cannot expect too much going in. The bed is fine as in most Four Points/Sheratons. The one thing which really prevented me from giving this hotel a 2 rating were the staff. The check-in/out staff were very friendly and I even noticed they were extremely patient with the lady ahead of me during check-out who was asking some rather stupid questions. Probably the best person at this hotel for me was the shuttle driver in the morning to take me back to SAN. He addressed me by name, recommended some places to visit next time I was in town and just had an overall great attitude. The service was so good that I might stay there again, although I'd be sure to book a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernUtahTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way through SanDiego. I was a bit worried when I read all the reviews, but our family was pleasantly surprised the moment we walked in. The open feeling was so nice - I actually loved the railings and NO it didn't feel like a prison - it was very nice and spacious everywhere - much better than small long hallways of a typical hotel. When we checked in, the girl at the desk was pleasant and recommended a room away from the dining area to avoid the noise at night, which we appreciated. She did have a rather large tongue ring that we couldn't help noticing, but she was very friendly and helpful. When we entered the room it was large and spacious with 2 queens, a large desk and chair and a very big flat screen TV. The room was clean and decor very nice. The beds were very comfy - one of the best I've slept in! There was a fridge, microwave and we apprciated the camomile tea and complimentary water bottle. The bathroom was clean and spacious - tub shower was nice. Location was GREAT!! There were several oriental/Thai restraunts just down the road that were exceptional (Korea BBQ was amazing). Our boys loved the grounds - lots of lawn and trees. They had fun kicking the soccer ball and throwing the frisbee Pool was large and heated and the hottub was huge, though not as hot as other hottubs we've been in. Gym was open late - we went around 10:30 and all the basics were there for a nice workout We ran into a security guy on the way to the gym and he was very helpful and we felt very safe. Hotel was easy to find and in an excellent location. Check out wasn't until noon which gave us extra time to do a little laundry and pack at our convenience instead of being rushed We would definately return again and highly recommend this hotel. By the way, I had bid on priceline for only $60 bucks! What a great deal!!!! So happy we stayed here

Reviews.Title: “It's not the best but I have seen better...”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the weekend and wanted to share my own experience. I was little afraid to see what people had to say in this review but with my own experience, it was 50/50. Hotel itself wass beautiful and opened but i didn't like the fact that there were some kind of clubbing on the first floor. Club itself was very quite once the door was shut but it was hard to deal with all of the drunk people who came out of the club. They were Enjoying the mood very much and enough to make continuence noise at the hallways. Because of this reason, I strongly suggest parents with the kids do not want to stay at this place. Other than the noise, front desk receptionist were okay ( I only had to say hello and good bye) and the bed were okay for me(who has sciatica issue). I would say it was about 2.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of renovation!”
Reviews.Author: granitedesk020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10 minutes from Sharp hospital, which makes it convenient when you need to be close to the hospital, as I did. The hallways are really wide. The food in the restaurant was good. Having giving you the positives, it's time for the negatives. My family had 2 rooms--both smelled REALLY terrible, like old smoking rooms. The "golf course" is a rip off--they've stuck a few bad golf holes in the old landscaping around the property and then they charge to play. The lights were way too bright in the restaurant and bar, which had no style at all. Sheraton should tear it down or clean it up.

Reviews.Title: “Standard value”
Reviews.Author: sting800
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides what you'd expect from a value brand - free internet, decent free hot breakfast for SPG Gold, free bottled water, free parking and a decent location near multiple highways as well as Montgomery Field Airport. Rooms were pretty dirty, mine had bloodstains under the table as well as on a curtain, and this was a SPG "preferred" room. Service was ok, front desk was hit or miss, housekeeping as well. I'd stay again if I had business near the area and the pricing was half that of the other Starwood properties in the area, like it was during my most recent trip.

Reviews.Title: “This place is HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lara S
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel experience ever!!! Our first room was very dirty. Second one was a little better. The original fridge was not working. They brought a second one to the room. It broke a night after us being there. I had my dog's medicine, as well as groceries from the farmer's market in there, which all spoiled:( Also, there was VERY LOUD construction going on right outside our room. The worst part about it was the property manger, Paul Caldani. He was very unprofessional and did not care about my concerns at all. In fact, he said dogs are "STINKY" and that he does not want them to be allowed on the property for much longer. I took this as a personal insult to me. I have a spoiled, fancy English bulldog that I love very much. I give her baths frequently. In fact, she had a bath the day before she hit the road for a 3 night vacation. He also stated the fridge in the room is a "luxury", and guests should not rely on it to work. I've stayed at lower star hotels that have a fridge in the room and were SOOO much more delightful than this experience. Ughh, worst EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and bad service--avoid”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpiritKT
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Monday with a reservation through my corporation website. This was a last minute reservation that was made on the prior Thursday. It was completely wrong! When I attempted to correct the date I was questioned by the front desk agent as to "Why did you book it wrong." This was a direct quote. This same agent didn't seem to understand that I was checking out on Friday. The room was not worth the rate! The hallway leading to the room had trash on the floor. This same used q-tip and bottle top was there the entire week. Later in the week I asked for a dinner delivery menu from the front desk, I was told NO. Not we don't have any (which in this area was really dificult to believe), but just NO. I also had a confernece call the next morning and used the hotel phone. There was a charge for calling and 800#. I questioned this and was told "You are staying in a hotel".. This is something I do Monday to Friday about 45 weeks a year. WOW...This is not a place I would stay again. Starwood and other Sheraton properties usually offer excellent service...this property is definately an exception a bad exception

Reviews.Title: “Potential for a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelleyV_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, as did 2 of our children. So we had a total of 3 rooms. The location is very central and easy to find. Close to freeways. I loved the free parking. It is a nice hotel. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful for the most part. The one negative about the hotel is the housekeeping department. The first 2 days, our room was kind of cleaned, but we were left with no towels, coffee or cups. Both days we had to go and ask for them. The next 2 days our room was not cleaned at all, all of the maids on the floor denied that our room was on their list. One day we just had them give us clean towels. When we got back to our room the next day and it had not been cleaned, we asked that it be cleaned and they did as we asked. At no time did we have a "please clean Later" tag on our door. I felt that the front desk should have apologized for this deficiency, but they didn't even hardly acknowledge it. We had a light bulb burned out, and I showed it to the housekeeper, but it still was not changed, until a day later when I called the front desk. There was a central area on each floor where there were chairs and couches. The first day we were there, our grandchildren spilled some crackers. The area was not vacuumed for 3 days. It was such an obvious mess, and we noticed that it had not been cleaned every day. quite a few times, I also noticed trash in the halls, and I would see employees just walk by it , and not stop to pick it up. Pride in our jobs comes from the top. Overall we had a good stay, and I would stay here again if I got a really good rate. I feel the management needs to be monitoring the floors, for trash, etc that is left. and setting an example for all of the employees. Our kids rooms were always cleaned but on 2 or 3 days they also were not left with any towels, or coffee, cup replenishment. The pool area is nice. They have a restaurant, but we did not eat there. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrm2u2004
Reviews.Content: Stay here 3 nights and really had no major issues. It is located in a business area and car is needed if you don't plan on eating at the hotel restaurant. If you are accustom nice contemporary this is not the place for you. This hotel was formally an office building and you can tell that remodeling expenses were kept to a minimum. The rooms are located in an atrium theme that looks just like an office building. So much more could have been done to jazz the place up!!! If you are not going to spend alot of time in your room then this is an ok hotel at tops. We stayed gone from 11a-8p so it was really just a place to shower and rest overnight as we took the kids to LegoLand about 35minutes away and Mission Bay Beach about 20mins. Mission Bay Beach was nice and has a small amusement park for kids and free parking. All in all for under $110 a day it was an ok stay, but being accustom nicer hotels I wound not stay again. Hotel did allow for a early checkin and a late check out that was appreciated. Save on $$$ here and miss out on all the nice finer amenities at hotels priced $160 above. My recommendations stay near Hotel Circle or Carlsbad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, hotel staff wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bluefaery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for business. The first night was awful. I was put in a room that adjoined to another room and was able to hear everything from the man staying next door. I was kept up all night long from his television, woken up from hearing him using the toilet (sounded as if he was urinating next to my bed) and heard every word of his phone conversations. The thing is, I don't think he was actually being that loud, the walls were just thin or the door between our rooms was. The next morning I went down to the front desk and requested my room to be moved. The staff was very helpful and even moved my bag for me. When I returned in the afternoon after work they had prepared my new room for me. The Sales Manager Brian overheard why I had requested the change and gave me a free drink coupon. Later while indulging in my free drink coupon at the bar another manager (older man) offered me a free cigar as well. I have zero complaints about the staff. They responded quickly and were very nice. The rooms were clean, however not super impressive. One other complaint about the rooms are that they all have large gaps under the doors which allow light and noise to stream in from the halls. I stuffed a towel under the door the 2nd night which helped a lot. The beds were very comfortable though.

Reviews.Title: “never lets us down”
Reviews.Author: bnanafana
Reviews.Content: This review will probably be the next bestseller of all hotel reviews lol..We were so impressed with this hotel once again because of how peaceful and quiet the stay always is..Our room was very comfortable and very cozy..room was very clean at check in and we have NEVER experienced bedbug problems at this hotel as someone said in previous reviews..Our stay was actually planned for the end of June, but we had to call the hotel and ask if they would be able to change our reservation for July because of a wildfire that our town in Arizona was experiencing at the time in June..Mind you, the reservation was non-refundable and also wasnt suppose to be changed..But, unlike what others said about the manager Rex not being very friendly or accomodating, Rex was so understanding!..He just asked my husband what was going on and my husband explained that we had to take in evacuees from the fire that became the largest wildfire of the summer here in the U.S...Rex was, like i said, so understanding and so accomodating to us and we couldnt be more grateful for his kind attitude towards our situation...We thoroughly enjoyed our stay once again and we have stayed at this hotel several times when in San Diego to visit our family there..This hotel always has the best prices and also has alot to offer nearby for food and shopping and easy freeway access..The hotel itself has a great restaurant for breakfast and also a great coffee bar in the lobby for those quick little pick me ups lol..Thank you once again to Four Points Sheraton for making us feel so welcomed and to Rex for being a very kind and understanding manager..We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews, I was scared, but it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Janet055
Reviews.Content: The hotel was client, quiet, spacious and convenient for driving. You will need a car to stay here. After reading the reviews, I was scared, but the reasonable price made me take a chance. I was very happy with the hotel. It is spacious, with very wide corridors and skylights creating an open feeling. Nights were very quiet in the room. Bedding was great, the pool was perfect -- overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Find Someplace else”
Reviews.Author: JohnBoy813
Reviews.Content: First tipoff that housekeeping was subpar was at check-in when we noticed that there was only one bar of soap. The next morning after showering we found out that there was no hair dryer, but one was sent up after we complained. As we were leaving for a day at the San Diego Zoo housekeeping was getting ready to go into the room next door to us, so I assumed our room would be next to be serviced. We spent the full day at the zoo and then went to the Gaslamp Quarter (had dinner at a great Irish Pub called The Field) and upon arriving back at the room we discovered that no one had been in the room to clean it. This was evidence as the room tip still there and all the dirty towels lying on the floor. We had to get new towels sent up and even then they did not give us a full set. I would only recoomend staying here if it were for only one night where the lack of housekeeping woud not matter. Also the hotel states they have free WIFI but it was almost impossible to get a signal.

Reviews.Title: “just a place if everything is booked”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one of those places you can stay if you cant find anything else. It is older and is in need of some redo. The staff was freindly and the place was just ok. They allow pets there, which I discovered one night when the neighbor dog started barking. The beds were comfortable and rooms did have free wi-fi, but it is really not near anywhere that would be walking distance. All in all, just a place to sleep, if you dont mind knowing that pet may have slept in your bed the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Agent wouldn't help me”
Reviews.Author: icebox888
Reviews.Content: I was helping my family look for a hotel by my apt and saw that this hotel was very closeby. I walked into the hotel and was surprised to see how nice the lobby looked. The outside looks like an old office building. I walked to the front desk and asked to see a room really quick just to get a feel for it. I was afraid of how the rooms might be since the reviews were so bad. The agent refused me and told me to come back earlier in the day. I explained to him that I work during the day and couldn't come during the better times. He still said no and told me to come back around 2. I will definitely have my family stay somewhere else since the front desk was so unwilling to help me

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF "MANAGMENT" REX" AND BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: thehotellady
Reviews.Content: Where do i start!!! First the check in with Bertha (WHO WAS EATING WHILE SHE WAS CHECKING ME IN while she was on a personal call ) She clearly did not know what she was doing, when rex came out to help he tried to balm me!! I travel for a living I know how it works. UGH If i was the owner of this hotel i would get ride of those TWO. Rex, you are so inconsiderate. Bertha, stop eating while checking someone in, and take you personal calls away from the front desk.. And to the Sheraton once you get ride of those two I be a return guest. Never will i stay at that Sheraton, HILTON rooms are much nicer, front desk is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton San Diego for two days during a business trip to UCSD in San Diego. Arrived with car. Four Points by Sheraton San Diego have free parking. The staff in the reception was very friendly, and as a SPG Platinum member my room was updated from a standard room to a suite. The staff in the reception was also very helpful in recommending a good restaurant to have dinner in the area. As mentioned by other reviewers it's not walking distance to much, so you need a car to get around. The room itself was ok, after my opinion, things were starting to look a little dated. Everything was however clean, and the bed was comfortable. The hotel has free high-speed Internet in all rooms, which is not something common in Sheraton hotels. The breakfast was also good. Overall, the stay was very good. The staff at the hotel was friendly, and I have no problems recommending the Four Points by Sheraton San Diego to other business travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Below Standard+Unethical”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Piyush
Reviews.Content: Below Standard: I made arrangements for my colleague to stay for 4 days. There was no internet for 24 hours. Internet was restored after 8 hours of escalations. Restored internet services did not last long. My colleague decided to move to another hotel on second day. Even the business cente has only one computer which is low for the price they charge. Unethical Despite commitment from staff, refund was not processed. Mr. Rex, was rude to us by stating that he does not believe that we are telling the truth. He does not pick up our calls any more, and does not even bother to respond our mails espite having read them. I am writing this review after getting convinced that the Mr. Rex and Four Points is not going to refund our money. Summary: Pathetic staff have downgraded hotel of repute. Very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Awful smell in rooms”
Reviews.Author: ritz0529
Reviews.Content: When we got to our hotel room my husband and I noticed an awful smell. The water from the cooler leaked to the carpet and the room reeked! we immediately called the front desk and asked to speak to a supervisor. We informed them of the smell and the best they could do was send a maid to spray the room for the night since they did not have any rooms available to change us to. My husband and I had to stay in the room with that awful smell for a whole night! I could not believe that they didn't have any rooms available with such a big hotel! Lets just say we will not be staying at any of the Sheraton Hotels again!

Reviews.Title: “They Don't Care, Neither Should You”
Reviews.Author: FPepoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bad experience from start to finish. I travel 80% of the time for work and frequently stay at Four Points, this is one to which I will never return. When I checked in, I requested an upgrade. I am Gold status, and I was told I was already in an upgraded SPG room, which turned out to be a flat-out lie. Then I found out several co-workers staying at the hotel, who were not SPG Gold and who checked in after I did, were given suites. Every time I interacted with the front desk staff, they acted as if they did not care and as if they had better things to do than help me. Then there was my room. Bathroom: dirty floor, clogged sink that despite repeated complaints was never fixed; beds: hard, uncomfortable, not enough pillows, and one pillow that smelled like body odor; decor: as outdated as it gets, dirty old carpet on the floor, broken tiles in the bath, not enough power outlets at the desk (only one.) And finally, this hotel does NOT have wireless internet, and they do NOT provide a cable for their wired service. And the wired service was slow and sporadic. There were a few highlights: the rooms have refrigerators and microwaves; room service was quick and the food was good; and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. Why don't they have the restaurant staff teach the front desk staff how to treat customers???

Reviews.Title: “Just one night in SD”
Reviews.Author: Chillinathtown
Reviews.Content: I got there not knowing what to expect. The first time at a Four Points and I will definitely try to stay more with them. Regular room with the basics and good appearance. Oh, free web, but not too sure if that was because of my status in Starwood. Bottom line, I would have wanted to stay more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: lmt_rlax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work conference. The shuttle service to and from the airport is great and very reliable. The staff is friendly. It's fairly run of the mill but I was working in the day and going out at night so it didn't matter much to me. It's not walking distance to much so you need a car to get around. Luckily I had work friends there with cars. I was pleased enough that I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Tierrasanta
Reviews.Content: Multiple reviews have labeled this as looking at a prison, this is an overstated remark. It is certainly not an architectural masterpiece from the outside, but the interior is pleasant. The hallways are amazing, the rooms across from each other are probably 50 feet apart. If you are a tourist, a car is necessary as most attractions are 5-10 miles away. The pool area is nice with adequate sitting and lounge chairs. Pets are acceptable and there is a charge. It is not a St. Regis, but is a nice family hotel. They also have a little pitch and putt golf course attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluedesert
Reviews.Content: So, I just had to see for myself: How can a nice hotel look like a prison? Well, with a little imagination, I could see the connection. However, that funny novelty aside, this is really a pleasant, refreshing place to stay with many nice attributes. The hotel itself is well maintained with a newer, bright, modern decor in a quiet parklike setting (even though it's next to a small airport, the plane noise was barely noticable). And that "prison" design actually helps give the place a bright, spacious feel (no long, dark corridors). To top it off the staff was great, the restaurant was solid (for hotel fare), the wireless internet was free (it worked most of the time), parking was free, the bed was comfy, it had a nice pool area, and the central location was great with about 10-20 minute drives to downtown, the zoo, Mission Bay, and La Jolla (plus you were out of the way of the hectic hotel corridors). A stay at the Four Points helped make for a great weekend getaway and I would definitely put it on my list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel in sunny san diego”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were only there one night, so although it is further out from the city, it is easy to find when driving, 5 mins drive to the zoo and ample parking when you are there, a rarity in san diego. We did go out clubbing though and found it easy to get a taxi there and back, for little cost. Rooms are good size and are clean and modern, the staff are helpful and friendly. The swimming pool and jacuzzi were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chesco_7
Reviews.Content: Just back from our trip which took in LA, San Diego and onto Vegas. Trusted Dial a flight with all our arrangements and they did a great job with all our various hotels. Four Points appeared a bit out of the way when we drove down from LA, but everything about the hotel was great. Reception area very nice and welcoming and check in was very quick and friendly. We were all impressed with the room which had 2 queen beds, fridge, micro, coffee maker, plenty storage and a desk for business users. Our room was immaculate and spacious and could not be faulted at all. After a hectic 9 days in LA we decided to chill out when we arrived and ended up going to the pool and hot tub (hotter than a bath and very relaxing), also a small gym which we didn't use. All very well maintained with sun loungers and towels provided. We opted for room service at night which was delivered prompt and the food was good. Just basic chicken and chips etc but really tasty and resonably priced. Distance wasn't a problem as we were driving but no more than 15 mins to the old town by car, and free car parking at hotel was an added bonus after $30 a night in LA!!! A great few days and the only problem we had is that we ran out of time. Would definately stay again (only for longer) on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “It is a Four Points. Not a good one, not a bad one but very average.”
Reviews.Author: jrh301
Reviews.Content: This is a Four Points, no more no less and seemingly like all SPG properties in San Diego, is also overpriced but at least with this one, not by much. It has the internal architecture of a prison block and feels like you are sleeping in a dorm which is not a big thing, but not my thing. Otherwise I dont have anything to complain about and it does the job if a bed to sleep in is your job to do.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CAlove_to_travel
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Diego and stayed at the Four Points . It is a simple hotel and served our purpose of needing a place to sleep. The bathrooms were totally remodeled but the room itself was clearly outdated. The sofa was in fact 3 recliners put together! Not comfortable at all! The pool is not very inviting. However, the hotel is close to every major sightseeing attraction and is very centrally located. For the price , its probably worth it if you will not need a resort to relax in after a day of sightseeing. The restaurant is very so-so .Skip it and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “just ok if all you need is somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: ONE_ONO_MAKI_SUSHI
Reviews.Content: upon arriving to room #1047 i was ferociously greeted by the neighboring guests dog, who almost bit me. would have been nice if front desk warned me about that. king bed size room big enough to accomodate a crib (crib $10 charge). just ok if all you need is somewhere to sleep. bed was awful. for those of you familiar with sheratons sweet sleeper bed , this is not it. best to walk to front desk if you need something most times i attempted to call them the line was busy. waited 45 minutes for bath towels to be delivered to room. mold growing on bath tub walls. location is great. 1 mile away from walmart and 15 minutes away from sea world/zoo. free parking a plus but back parking lot does not have lights @ night.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasantly surprised...Thrilled with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous321
Reviews.Content: I've never written a trip advisor or any type of online review, but we were so pleased with our stay, that I thought this hotel deserved one. First off, I must admit, I have not stayed in a Sheraton hotel since I was a teenager, and always have had an idea in my head they they were super 80s and outdated. Not sure what the idea behind Four Points is, but this San Diego location was absolutely wonderful. I believe my husband stayed at one in Phoenix that was a bummer. If you have a car, and don't mind not being able to walk to restaurants or sights, this is really a great value. The hotel is newly updated, has stylish rooms (not the hotel at large), is pet-friendly and really well run. There is a heated swimming pool and hot tub, a work out room that I didn't use, a restaurant that has a decent breakfast deal (breakfast food is Denny's quality), and a bar that was closed during our stay. The bar would have been key, so you could have drinks and not have to leave the hotel. Free wi-fi, cable, room service, really clean, and brand new. I appreciated all of the cute marketing pieces and toiletries--reminded me of Bliss Spa or something. They did a great job and brought a design aesthetic to what you would think of as a giant corporate hotel. We booked through Travelocity, got a great rate, and just expected a place to sleep. This was definitely a little treat! The hotel was really empty when we stayed and I felt bad that more people were not taking advantage of this place. It served as a great home base on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, Noisy Room and Poor Managment”
Reviews.Author: LookingForGoodHotels
Reviews.Content: The major offense of the hotel is that they have people working on repairing the roof starting at 6:30AM. Only poor management with no regards for customer's comfort would allow such noisy repair at such unreasonable hour. I called to complaint but only received lip service with no action taken. The person at the front desk was unsympathetic and showed lack of interest. All these combined showed their lack of interest and awareness for customer's comfort. The air conditioning in the room worked well but was unbearably loud. It was like have a lawn mower in the room! The air conditioning units are those commonly found in cheap motel. Don't count on having a good night sleep. The dirty dishes from previous customers were out by the door during my entire stay. No one picked them up! Being a platinum member of Starwood, I have stayed at many sheratons and four points. This is by far the worst Starwood property that I have stayed. It is a cheap motel that should not have starwood name nor price.

Reviews.Title: “They charged my card three times still waiting for refund”
Reviews.Author: IzzieB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of July. I had difficulty booking online through their website as I didn't have a USA address, so I phoned the reservation helpline and booked over the phone. The staff member was not able to give me the cheaper internet rate but I continued with my booking as I was pressed with time. We checked in later sames day and stayed for 3 nights. I then enquired about whether we could stay one more night. Front desk staff were dismissive when I asked for the internet rate for the 4th night, I booked online for the 4th night. On checking out we were told there was no booking for us, funny as when we checked in there was? On pressing them further they found 2 booking for us one for 2010. There was a lot of passing the buck and nothing was solved during the nearly 2 hours we spent in reception trying to resolve the matter. I showed them they had already charged my credit card as I had checked at the bank. They insisted they hadn't. W e wasted a LOT of time here and missed our deadline in the next city. On my return to NZ I have checked with my bank and this hotel has charged me 3 times for 4 nights accommodation and refunded me only once, I have sent them an email but as of yet I have had no contact from them. They owe me us$609 that they have overcharged my card by putting through one transaction 3 times. They have made no effort to contact me despite the fact that we left the hotel after nearly 2 hours of waiting in reception with our children while they tried to sort out their booking mess. Good things about this hotel, the room was o.k, the free shuttle service is very handy to get to Seaworld, Zoo, downtown, Balboa park etc. The shuttle drivers are excellent, the hotel staff are lacking in customer service skills. The restaurant staff were very helpful and the $10 buffet lunch I thought was good value. The staff on the front desk really let down the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but greatness stops there....”
Reviews.Author: sarah7821
Reviews.Content: Negative: Bed was hard, sheets were rough which made for an uncomfortable nights sleep. The room smelt of cleaner, though the vanity was dirty upon arrival. The bathroom was quite small so only one of us could get ready at a time. The towels were very rough like brillo pads Free breakfast was not worth the walk to the lobby area, dry and tastless! Positive Perfect location, providing free parking, 12 minutes to Balboa park, 15 minutes to the harbor or mission beach, easy acces to several freeways. Room service was prompt and friendly (though expensive) Decor was decent with plenty of desk space. Fairly quite and private overall Overall not bad for the price, but wish the bed was more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent place with a friendly, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Don't be turned off by any nay sayers about this hotel; it's a very nice place. Even though it appears, on a map, far from San Diego attractions, the city in small enough to get to those places from the hotel in a short time and the freeways are very close. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I don't know what there is to complain about. I guess some people are hard to please. If you're easy going and want a nice clean place, here it is!

Reviews.Title: “Classic and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: Four points San Diego was a pleasant stay. We arrived in the early afternoon and would not expect our room would be ready. However, the reservation staff made every attempt to get us a room even when we said that we can return later. He had a room that would be ready in 5 minutes. The room was a suite with two separate connecting rooms. The room was clean and had a classic style we have seen many years in the past. Each room had a separate air conditioning unit (commonly call a swamp cooler). Internet is free at all Four Point hotels and there is no charge for parking and there is no valet or luggage assistance. The Hotel is located off the freeway tucked in the corner among the palm trees. I do not think we could have found this place without our navigator. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was concerned about our comfort while at the hotel and the reservation staff made every attempt to get us the best room as a platinum member. The hotel could use an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “"A Great Father's Day Getaway...Room 3088"”
Reviews.Author: goriajk
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I drove down the coast to 'America's Finest City' this past weekend to see The Padres vs. Oakland at Petco. We decided to stay at Four Points S.D. due to it's location (Near Montgomery Field & Downtown S.D.) and the fact we've stayed here before (last year while the hotel was under renovation). Well, the hotel renovation is complete, and we were quite impressed with the result. Yes, other reviewers have commented on 'The Prison-like hallways' but the room is anything but a 'cell' - The Beds were comfy, the coffee free and a fridge along with microwave. The room was quite modern with wood-trim touches. I liked it, and along with the outdoor Pool & Jacuzzi - This property has become one of my favorites. We will most certainly return. Peace - JG

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: RBM1
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location near restaurants and stores, fridge & microwave in room, free water bottles, free wireless in rooms, free parking, nice shower/water pressure, recently renovated Cons: The room seemed pretty awkward - all of the furniture seemed too big for the living room in the suite. Although recently renovated, still seems old. We stayed in a suite using our Starwood points and chose this hotel over the Sheraton Suites because of location and since it was recently renovated. However, I think next time I'd try the Sheraton. Even though this was remodeled, it still seems tired/old. Also, the other entrances to the hotel (away from the lobby) didn't seem secure - the doors were always propped open or unlocked. We did like the fact that there was a small fridge and microwave. The fridge was actually cold and the freezer actually froze! Sometimes, that doesn't happen in hotel fridges. The crib that was provided for our toddler was a mini-crib - much smaller than a regular sized crib. If she was over 2 years old, it would've been to small. We didn't encounter many other guests so we didn't have problems with noise, although I could hear the elevator going up and down although we were down the hall from it. There's a very tired, old golf course which I can't believe they actually advertise as an "executive golf course." Can't say anything about service since our room was located near one of the other entrances so we only saw the staff during check-in and check-out. I only saw housekeeping in the hallways once or twice during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What is with the prison like hallways?”
Reviews.Author: jreelfs
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton Well this will be my second time staying at the Four Points by Sheraton and unlike other reviews I am still not satisified with the room conditions. In fact I received the same exact room I did at my first stay. Overall the hotel is nice, the property seems to be in good condition, the parking is plenty ample, and free!! The roomâ€™s have mini fridges plus microwaves, thermostat controlled air conditioning, nice large spaced work desk and comfortable recliner. However the room is rather small in size and the dÃ©cor seems rather blah.. Everything is just to plain, the housekeeping attention to detail isnâ€™t that great either. I found multiple things in the bathroom alone that went uncleaned, or un-treated. The bathtub was rusty and the bathroom had a little smell to it. The bed was comfortable, the air worked great, and well everything just basically served its purpose, nothing more though. The tv was alright, decent amount of channels, however since the television was so old colors would blend from time to time, and the sound never sounded natural. Itâ€™s about time that the Four Points upgrade to new flat panel tvâ€™s, but that would mean they would also have to focus more on keeping the room clean and up to date. Like I said it wasnâ€™t the worst hotel I have stayed in, but basically itâ€™s just a little better than a Ramada or Super 8. I would definitely reconsider this hotels 3 star rating. I would say the only reason its rated as a 3 star establishment is because of the restaurants and the convention area, along with the golf course, which are all fine and dandy, but they lack in attention to detail in their rooms. I would much rather spend the little more money and stay at the Courtyard or Doubletree, and get a much better experience, even if I would have to pay for parking over there. Itâ€™s much worth it for the comfort. On another bright note the staff was friendly and always wanting to help, which means that if no other hotels were available I would be coming back to this one, because in the end, its not the worst. Oh and what is with the prison like hallways? They make the hotel very unbecomming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: taladas
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this hotel by mistake.. wanted to stay at the Holiday Inn Express downtown, but we were looking at Four Points in Los Angeles and "Four Points" somehow stuck in my head. By the time I realized that I clicked on the wrong link for San Diego, it was too late to do anything (the rate we got it for was completely non-refundable). Nevertheless, we did not regret the mistake one little bit. This is a great hotel in a quiet area, and really not all that far away from downtown... 15 minutes by car via the 163 to the Gaslamp Quarter (on a Sunday morning). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when we asked for eating suggestions, scenic route driving suggestions to LA (we didn't just want to go on the I-5) and mailing our postcards. They even offered to drive us downtown for free in their shuttle, but we would have had to take a taxi back (about $30 they said), so we drove instead. (In our experience, no other hotel has ever offered anything for free--except the $50 play money we got in Vegas, on which we won $90.. :) The hotel was very nice and clean. It did indeed look a little weird with the large hallways and all that, but we actually thought that was neat.. never seen a place like that. Someone before said that it was hard to find their room.. ever thought to inquire at the front desk how to GET to your room? :P The room itself was spotless, as was the bathroom. Nothing fancy or anything but we didn't travel to San Diego to stay in the room. There were cheaper hotels of course, but for the extra few dollars (it cost CAD $105 per night) we got a clean room (where we didn't have to worry about the cockroaches scattering when we came in at night and turned the ligths on) and a very comfortable bed. All in all, we enjoyed our stay (probably a total of 12-14 hours in the hotel itself in the two nights/three days we stayed in San Diego) and we will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Relaxing and Enjoyable Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Showdir
Reviews.Content: Was scheduled to attend a Wedding and Reception at the property and was Pleasantly supprized with the upgraded amenities. "Great relaxing pool side comfort." Staff was really friendly and accomidating to my questions and assistance. The Kitchen staff and food was amazingly suberb and I didn't have to go elsewhere for the service and selections that was offered. Loved the Fact that the property was family friendly and the kids were getting treated special. The standard rooms were spacious and quiet. I love the fact that the renovations and the remodeling of the property really showed the care and need toward the traveler's comfort and relaxation. Definitely would recomend this propertry to all of my freinds and clients for that relaxing getaway. I also enjoyed the fact that it was centrally located easilied accessible to downtown, the outlets, casino's and the beach. "Four Points Sheraton ROCKS"

Reviews.Title: “I Loved the Four Points by Sheriton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Gege35
Reviews.Content: The facilities were excellent and the people were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The meals at their restaurant were tastefully prepared and served. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit there and will return there whenever I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: travel4family
Reviews.Content: I had booked a party with the hotel and the overall experience was great. With the reservations desk they were able to accommodate all of our guests (120). The sales dept. helped out with planning of our event. They were very helpful and cooperative. The maid service was great at keeping the rooms clean. The restaurant had such a great variety on their menu which was very good for all our guests to enjoy. The banquet department really helped out and made our event a successful event to remember. Overall rating was very well pleased. I would recommend all my friends and everybody else to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: atchelitz
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights (Sept 14th to 18th) and enjoyed our stay very much. There are still some minor renovations to be completed, but we were not troubled by any noise or other aspects of the work being done. The hotel itself was very clean and our room was spotless and well kept. The hotel itself is a bit removed from everyday "conveniences" (shopping and restaurants) unless you have transportation. However the shuttle service offered is excellent and extremely punctual! We found the staff to be friendly and cheerful. In particular, the front desk staff and our shuttle drivers went out of their way to give us good advice on what to see and do to help us enjoy our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not high end but very decent...still remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Budgeted-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on Sept. 5-7. Overall: They are still doing some remodeling but they are about 90% done. Outside Decor: Clean with lots of trees. Fountain located at front entrance with check-in desk located to the right off the entrance and cafe and restaurant located on the left. Since it's located within a golf range, it's not bad. Parking: The only Sheraton in San Diego with FREE PARKING!! The hotel and parking lot is about a 1/2 block in from the main street. The parking lot is a bit dark at night so it's best to have a timed-delay for your headlights. When you arrive or parking for the night, park in the right lot that loops around the building as this lot is closer to the rooms. The parking lot of the left lot is closer to the restaurant and cafe (not best to park here on Sundays). Parking lot could be repaved and lines drawn because you'll notice that people will park all randomly in the first lot you arrive in. Interior: Very nice lobby until you get to the room "hallways" (see pictures). Like what others have said, the area where the rooms are located is very prison like. The way the building is formed, there are 3 hallways that all look alike and there is no signage tell you which rooms are in which area. There are sofas located in the middle and ends of each hallway. The elevator badly needs maintenance. Don't be surprise if it waddles and shakes a little. Other than that, it's pretty bare. Rooms: Very clean, except for the tub tiles. There is microwave, fridge, 20" TV and desk. Plenty of channels to watch including HBO and HBO family. There's Cartoon Network and Nick, but sorry no Disney. Beds are clean and comfortable. The AC/Heat unit is standard and loud like others, too bad they didn't install quite units. Minor differences b/w the pictures you see here and what's in the room. The pictures in this website was for a room located in the 1st floor and I stayed on the 3rd floor. There are no views for any of the rooms due to the trees and layout of place. Area: Even though it's away from downtown and other tourist hot spots, you're very close to everything. You're no more than 10 min. drive to SeaWorld, Downtown, Airport, Old Town, and beaches. If you're only staying for the weekend, don't bother renting a car. They have shuttles that will pick you up and take you around....BUT you must call ahead of time and confirm. This hotel is next to another smaller airport for private planes and helicopters, but you'll never hear anything. It's also very close to 805 & 163, but you'll never hear anything either. Food: Your blocks within a Korean district with lots of restaurants and grocery shopping. When exiting the hotel parking lot, turn right, go two blocks to Convoy St, turn right and starting from there and for the next mile there will be lots of places to eat. There are also lots of other places to eat on Balboa Ave and Clairemont Mesa Blvd (these are cross streets). A 24 hour Walmart and Food4Less is located on the 805 side of Clairemont Mesa Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “More positives than negatives”
Reviews.Author: NancyBoomer
Reviews.Content: We had a problem upon check-in -- our AC unit was dead. We waited about two hours for the repairs to take place (and were afraid to unpack, for fear we'd have to eventually move to another room). Long story short, they took care of the problem after a few phone calls and comped us for breakfast for two for the rest of our stay -- five nights! That kind of attention will keep us coming back. Pros: Convenient, easy-to-access location; exceptionally cordial staff; nice rooms with a new fridge and microwave; nice pool; free wi-fi; free parking; free daily bottle of water and USA Today. Negatives: (1) Very strange layout of the hotel. There is an average-looking lobby and several long, very wide, very dated-looking (almost industrial-looking) hallways where the rooms are located. None of the hallways is marked, so you have no idea where your room is. (2) Ridiculously small "fitness center." Why bother? Maybe both of these problems will be eliminated with the ongoing renovation. If so, this will be a very nice property and a good value. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, helpful staff, strange atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SportsFan59
Reviews.Content: The property appears to be about 90% done with a renovation, and the results are very nice. Our room was beautiful; nice decor, very comfortable. The staff was unfailingly helpful and knowledgable. The lobby is very attractive. There is a 9 hole golf course attached to the hotel with very reasonable fees, and you can rent clubs. There is a restaurant that is located adjacent to the main lobby which serves breakfast, lunch & dinner; it was very pricey and we avoided it after the first day. However, this is a very strange property. Three wings, wide, open interior hallways and an atrium style gives the place a cavernous, cold feeling. Every Saturday night, the little bar area is taken over by a over 30's singles club which means that area is off limits to hotel guests. Sunday mornings, a meeting room directly off the lobby is the site of a very large church service. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Jose B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in april 08- nice room although bathroom was a little small. They were refurbishing the hotel during our stay- but this was only during the day so had no real impact. very friendly staff- especially at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Soon, but not now”
Reviews.Author: spoonroe
Reviews.Content: First off let me say let this place has a lot of potential and I'm sure it will get there but for now please do yourself a favor and stay away for a little while. The hotel is undergoing extensive renovation, this itself is okay and can be lived with however once your room floods TWICE because of the renovations below and above you, you'd do a lot better to stay away for 6 months or so. Sometime during my first night there was a blockage in one of the rooms being renovated either below me or above me and an air bubble caused my bathroom sink to overflow into the bathroom (according to maintenance), covering the entire bathroom floor and all MY TOILETRIES with brown gunky water. This was not cool, however maintenance did show up fast and cleaned it up, then supposedly snaked the drain while I was out that day. However the next morning the exact same thing happened, needless to say I was livid. Renovation is one thing unlivable rooms is another. Management did quickly move me though. As you can see in one of the photos another guest posted there is construction material in the halls, that is no joke, it really is there and the hotel smells like a construction site. Well at least my room did, the strong odor of paint is very evident and the rest of the hotel air is very.....I donâ€™t know....muggy. Bottom line is, this is just not a very good place to stay right now. Oh did I mention that the gym equipment was sub par at best. One treadmill, no water, huge workout towels (think beach towels) and broken weight equipment. Uhh the more I type the more depressed I'm getting, since at the time of this review I am still staying there ;( On the bright side though, the free internet (very slow) and free water is a plus. The rooms are nice if they donâ€™t flood and reek and the microwave and fridge are a great addition. Still the smell of paint ---- come on. The pros just do not outweigh the cons; they should close this place down and just bang this renovation out. Lucky for me I have another reservation downtown this Friday at another Sheraton and can not wait for that day to come. Anyway just don't do it, please take my advice and stay away. I'm no complainer and usually suck it up, in fact this is the first online review I have ever done -- it was that bad and I just can't stand to think of someone else going through this. To be completely fair though if you wait six months and they actually do finish the renovations and fix that gym, this will be a very nice place. God help you though if their not done yet in 6 months though.

Reviews.Title: “was shocked”
Reviews.Author: sl1953
Reviews.Content: Light renovations? ................Not. Out side our door was apx. 30 feet by 15 feet if desks, chairs, bedding, dust and the strong smell of carpet glue pilled 6 feet high and we were not the only ones with this view. I was embarrassed that things were so under construction. There was a couple in the parking lost arguing about the hotel. This is not a kid friendly place because a small hand could easily grasp something sharp in these piles. Best to stay away, event if you are adventuress type for at least 6 months or more.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel despite ongoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: schmink45
Reviews.Content: It's part of the Starwood family of hotels. We had a western regional Yamaha STAR motorcycle (that's a type of cruiser motorcycle, BTW, like Toyota Camry or Honda Accord-you know, a model of a make) 'convention' type thingy going on from Friday until Sunday. The hotel allowed us to take up a goodly amount of their spacious parking lot for m/c vendors, demo rides w/Yamaha, skills contests, etc. We had the whole lounge area on Friday night for a "Meet & Greet" and karaoke. The drink prices in the lounge weren't too bad ($4 for a Coors Light, not bad for inside a hotel) and the grounds were pretty darn nice with a VERY clean pool and jacuzzi, and two 'pitch & putt" par 3 holes. They also have a coffee cart and a little gift shop with the usual analgesics, toiletry items, yada, yada, yada. The renovation project wasn't too bad, although I heard from some folks who had been staying the week that the jackhammers were a bit much, but we didn't hear anything. Frankly, for a hotel to 'put up with' a bunch of bikers (well, actually people with a median age of 40-45 riding cruisers and who pride themselves on SAFETY FIRST) is a pretty darn cool hotel, in my opinion, because around 300+ motorcycles parked in a parking lot usually kinda makes people a leetle bit apprehensive. FYI INFO- Room service menu kinda pricey, but aren't they all? Room was nice, lots of storage, shampoo and conditioner and bath bars and facial bars and hairdryer. Refridge and microwave and coffee maker with Seattle's Best Coffee and Tazo tea (we didn't find the microwave until we opened up a cupboard looking for extra things to pack when leaving, and it surprised us) 'Citrus' restaurant had a nice selection of breakfasts, plus a nice breakfast buffet for $14-15. On weekdays, I guess they have an omelette bar, but not on weekends. Saw a flyer for a Champagne Sunday brunch, but we had to leave & try to beat the rain-we're on motorcycles, remember? We were given free bottles of water in our room every day-that was a definitely nice touch. Refridgerator was available, and DIDN'T have any of the usual overpriced drinks already inside. That was pretty cool! Lounge had a popcorn machine & free popcorn for a snack-nice touch. They have a fitness center-didn't try it. The pool temp was pleasantly at around 70 and the jacuzzi around 100. Our group had one of the big rooms and we had the roast beef catered dinner with squash, potatoes, salad with olives, feta cheese & 2 dressings, rolls, coffee, chocolate cake, 2 cash 'no-host' bars & mic system. The roast beef wasn't that good, frankly, but again, it's a catered meal in a hotel. I kinda wish our group guys could've offered us a choice of beef or chicken or fish, but oh well. Just something to think about next year.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in san diego”
Reviews.Author: katysmith101
Reviews.Content: definately our favourite hotel, lovely room, very spacious and clean, really helpful staff, loads of maps, directions and suggestions - had christmas buffet dinner here, which was lovely too. Would defiantley stay again - a bit out of town, but that was fine too, would need a car though. Good fitness room, pool and free internet access too. They were doing renovations at the time, but we were not inconvienenced in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Ew, could of been better”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovations. Some rooms have been done and look nice but the quality of the work will show in a few months. Personally, I would of never put Pergo Flooring in the entry of every room. I think the originally design looks like they tried for "Modern"... but it is just sterile and blan. The lobby is all grey. The rooms were clean and well appointed but I wasn't overly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel under major renovations, not the greatest time to visit...”
Reviews.Author: PUCCA74
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Points San Diego and was a little disappointed by the fact that the hotel was under major renovations. The back door leading to the parking lot was open in the evening when I checked in, so it was convenient getting my bags inside. But, in the morning, the construction crew covered off this entire back area leading to the parking car, where my car was parked! This was extremely inconvenient, as I had to go all the way around the hotel to get to my car and then pull in front to put my bags in the trunk. I stayed here b/c the reputation of the hotel brand is good and you know what to expect of the rooms. Also, the property offered free parking and internet in the room, a great value, considering that other hotels charge for these things. If you are on a budget, staying at this hotel is fine, but I would advise that you check and make sure that the construction is over before you book your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant one night stay”
Reviews.Author: joerad
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night as part of a Western Trails tour. I have to say after reading some of the previous reviews, I was a little concerned. To my surprise it was actually OK. Yes it is layed out like a prison cell block, but the room we were allocated had obvioulsy been referbished and was very clean and modern.The staff seemed helpful. We didn't have an evening meal, but the buffet breakfast was reasonably priced. It is not centrally located, but I would recommend it for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its Getting Better, Don't Worry! See the Pictures!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: I was in this property on the weekend of 9/29 visiting friends. The hotel price was one of the cheapest in SPG property in SD area plus it gives free parking/ internet so I chose this property, actually, it didn't turn out as bad as others stated! Offered 4 PM late checkout for SPG members w/o asking. deluxe room upgrade as well. You have to understand, you are staying at 4 points, not at westin or st.regis (and look at the rate that you are paying at this property)! so you have to judge them with a different scale (its like comparing a fast food vs a dine in restaurant, give me a break!) Location- This hotel's location is pretty decent to me! close to major freeways and local shops (Walmart, Fry's, etc), fast food store nearby the site and close to the sharp hospital and Convoy street (tons of Asian - Chinese/Japanese/Korean/Vietnamese food and market place)! Super convinent! and parking in this area are lot easier than downtown hotels and best of all, FREE parking! Landscape - pretty nice! they got golf courses where many family came over the weekend with their kids playing golf, very quiet most of the time at the hotel too. Very safe to park as well. Hotel - the front desk people were nice, they were very accomondating and let the guest know that they are renovating the hotel (yes they are replacing the carpet for those who cared) and of course, when you are replacing the carpet, you'll have the smell, but its not that horrible. The hotel is divided into 3 wings - A B C and the rooms are basically the same, just depends on whether u want a pool view or a golf course view. 3 stories tall hotel with 2 elevators (I, along with many other guests that i have seem are walking on stairs). The hotel has a nice outdoor pool with jacuzzi (heated) and smallish gym too. Room - nice size, bigger than SD sheraton marina's east tower club room. New four comfort bed, and sheets are actually more crisp compare to the SD marina sheraton too. Free internet in room and 2 bottles of aarowhead water too. SHower head is the same/similiar as the westin heavnly shower (solo head version) and the pressure is stronger than most other hotels. The room also got microwave, iron board, and coffeemakers in the room (seattles best). Overall, I give this hotel a 3* rating since the renovation is still in process, I think once its done with the renovation, it will be alot nicer and earn better rating among others and I. * note, I don't like the jail bar design too, I think the wall should be repainted to more brighter, lively color to make it more vivid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: 2DesertCats
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and I'm not sure that I stayed at the same hotel as the negative reviewers. The hotel is currently being renovated. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The resturant is good. We only ate breakfast there so, we don't know how lunch and dinner are. The lounge is nice but, don't go there on Friday night unless you want to dance. The hotel is not close to downtown San Diego and attractions like Sea World. It is also not a resort. It seems to cater more to business travelers. If staying at a resort or near downtown or attractions are important to you, you might not like this hotel. However, since it is not overlooking a freeway, it is quiter.

Reviews.Title: “Major rip off”
Reviews.Author: Jet40
Reviews.Content: I took my son for what was supposed to be a special time for his graduation present, and what we recieved was a hotel from ****. The hotel at best looks like a jail cell block. The walls are grey, with no pictures or anything. The front dest staff couldn't be more rude. I sure wish I would have read the reviews before I booked my stay. I think they should have paid me the $240.00. Take my word for it, it would be better to stay home, then staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Disgusting Property”
Reviews.Author: Route162
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know that Four Points is Starwood's low low end brand, but I had no idea there were no standards at all.. I was booked here by my hosts on a short business trip, and checked out after the first night. My room was on the main floor. All the furniture except the bed were badly dog eared. The carpet filthy and badly stained. The bathroom tile looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. Towel rack rusted to nearly breaking. Bathroom door broken, and the handle all gooey. Stay away from this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Best all-you-can-eat Chinese buffet ever nearby!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAngel5
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night as part of a coach tour and it seemed to be quite peripheral, certainly not what I would consider to be in San Diego itself. As such, it was good for the tour because we had an early start and it meant we were out of the city and on the road early. But it isn't a very built up area at all. Nice and quiet as a result though. The hotel itself was clean but not exactly cosy. It was pretty clinical and resembled some sort of prison the way it was laid out with different wings! It was quite business-conferency! We didn't eat in the hotel but had dinner at a near by all-you-can-eat Chinese buffet, which was fantastic! The concierge had actually recommended another Chinese to us so that would imply that there are a few places to eat in the vicinity. There is a small shop and coffee bar in the hotel. All in all it is a nice enough hotel, quite impersonal but not bad by any stretch of the imagination. I really loved San Diego and hope to go back but doubt I would stay at the same hotel purely because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Coast2Coast-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 8 - 13 jan 2007 on a business trip on a reccomendation from a colleague. The entire stay was a very pleasant one. The entire staff was very friendly, helpful, accomodated every need, and basically bent over backwards to be helpful. The room was clean and kept that way every day, as well as the rest of the hotel. There were an assortment of pillows to choose from, which is usually a complaint of mine at hotels because they are so small and tend to give me a headache. The room wasn't huge, but was adequate for my needs. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a group”
Reviews.Author: Taxlass23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton over Thanksgiving Weekend while we attended a soccer tournament, and were most pleasantly surprised. Although the hotel is not located in what I would call a "garden spot," the facilities truly exceeded my expectations. The room rates were excellent, check in and check out went very well, the rooms were large, clean and well-maintained, and there was plenty for our players to do when they were not on the pitch. The pool and spa were great, the fitness center was maybe not the most well-equipped on the planet but perfectly acceptable, and there was a 9-hole 3-par golf course on the premises. Staff bent over backwards to accomodate us. Example: we had brought cereal and fruit along and wanted to buy a couple of cartons of milk and get a couple of bowls and spoons. The people at the restaurant just gave us everything without charging us. Parking was free and there was no minimum nights' stay. We also had lunch at the Citrus restaurant and although it was a bit pricey, it was delicious and the portions were ginormous - something our ravenous soccer players truly appreciated. Thanks, Four Points Sheraton, for coming through.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: MSLSV
Reviews.Content: This was simply a terrible hotel. Bellman was busy watching TV in the lobby instead of helping me drag in my luggage. Two front desk clerks were busy in a personal conversation and didn't stop when I walked up to the desk, I had to wait about 30-seconds until they were done. Room was terrible, old carpet, wallpaper, musty smell. I went back to the desk to change rooms and was told "oh, all our rooms are like that, we're going to renovate soon but haven't started yet". So I guess I lucked out and had to pay full rate for something I'd expect from a Motel 6. Restaurant was good, which was the only saving grace to this place. At the pool, I saw an employee leave via the locking gates and keeping it ajar so he could come back, and when he did, he left the gate still ajar I guess for the next employee who's too lazy to use a key. I'm glad I don't have a toddler who might wander into the pool area and fall in the pool. I mentioned it to the front desk and was told "I'll let my manager know" but got that feeling that she wasn't going to say a thing, as she didn't write anything down and just went back to what she was doing when we were done talking. You know that feeling? Someone saying something to you just to satisfy you but they really don't mean it? That's the overall feeling I got from this place. For the money, you can do a lot better in San Diego. Take a pass on this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fab - if you are used to prison architecture”
Reviews.Author: Mike&Jackie
Reviews.Content: We're having real problems identifying with some of the other reviews for this hotel. We've just stayed here for 4 nights and could not believe how gloomy both the overall design of the hotel and attitude of the staff were. It is in the middle of nowhere so, yes, a car is a must, and the pool and golf course are too small to worry about. That said, the beds were super-comfortable and the hotel offers free 24 hour internet access which was very useful. In our view, there are much nicer, more upmarket places to stay that aren't as expensive downtown, closer to the sights. We certainly wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice moderately priced place.”
Reviews.Author: rmmrph
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, reasonably priced hotel. It well maintained and clean. My only complaint is that on the door to the parking lot on our wing did not close properly. It had a tendency to slam shut if you let it. Which on our first night a bunch of boisterous young folks, did at least a dozen times (they were in and out several times). If you were located upstairs or further down the wing you probably would not even really heard/felt it. But being on the first floor right next to the external door, it actually shook our room wall. No problems with the door slamming on the other 2 days. I would stay here again if I go to a Chargers game again because it only 2 miles to the stadium. The pool was on the small side but nice enough.
