Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Hotel for Cheap Weekend Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: happytravelgrl
Reviews.Content: This was a good experience, and we were traveling with a nine month-old baby. We wanted to book an affordable last-minute getaway from Los Angeles during the peak expensive Summer season. This hotel worked out great and is in a central location for the price - close to Old Town & SeaWorld, not too far south from La Joya, yet convienent to most highways if you want to go downtown or to Mexico, all of which we were in town for during a weekend. The hotel is not the destination, but it is a nice place to sleep. Our bed was new, and exceptionally comfortable. Our room and carpet was extremely clean and everything was in working order, especially nice since it is time for the property to be remodeled. It does not show its age as much as you would think, however you will see some slight wear on the wooden furniture, tub and slight rust here and there in small places on the bathroom ceiling. The baths definately need a remodel, the tubs are small, but are working and clean to Sheraton standards and for business travel. The outdoor pool is small, but very clean and well-maintained, open 6am to 11pm, next to the fitness center. Having a tiny Starbucks stand in the lobby is a nice treat, but it opens at 6am and closes before dinner time. We did not use the golf course. Overall the good experience with the staff and rates here out-weigh the major bad issues, which are the same as mentioned in the other reviews; you definately do need a rental car if you choose to stay here, and also what some have previously called "antiseptic" decor. Actually, that is not the best way to describe the layout - it is very much like a three-story airport terminal, very wide institutional style open corredors with no decorations or color. You will understand if you go. But that in itself is no reason to pass on this property, unless you are looking to pay top dollar for the elegant upscale decor of the properties around Mission Beach or La Joya. The rooms do offer some style and color lacking from the huge hallways, a more than comfortable place to sleep. There is a quiet small bar, and an okay restaurant, average hotel food on the pricey side - $15-20 per adult for dinner, but that is the price of convienence. There is plenty to see and do in town without needing to eat in the hotel. Fish tacos are a Southern California treat to look for if visiting from out of state, and there are plenty of good taco places downtown by the waterfront. Or Mexican food if visiting Old Town, which we highly recommend that you try to do here. Check out La Joya if you would like beautiful upscale Pacific vistas and designer restaurants or shopping - think Cartier and Armani meets small town California coastal villiage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Points!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, I thought this hotel was great. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband and I went to San Diego for vacation and we were happy to get a room with a fridge/microwave when we requested one at check in. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I agree with other reviews stating that you should rent a car if you stay here. There is nothing within walking distance. The golf course could definitely use some work, but what can you really expect for $6? We loved how everything we wanted to do was 10-15 away. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Muzak that wouldn't stop”
Reviews.Author: Ramblin_Man_CA
Reviews.Content: The staff could not figure out how to turn off the awful muzak that echoes through this dated, cavernous hotel. When I called the front desk at 10:30 PM and asked them to turn it off, they said that "we don't know how. Just stuff a towel under your door." Had to turn on the heater to produce white noise that would cancel the '70s tunes. What a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton 4 Points Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Four Points on a four day business trip during November 2005. Check-in was fast, but did not offer to explain some of the features available at the hotel. Room and house keeping staff was excellent. Hotel restaurant: Food was excellent quality, average price for hotel restaurant. Wait service could have been better. When you make your reservations, check to see if you qualify for the Motfield Club rate. You get free breakfast, dinner, drinks, and golf as part of the club. Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and safe lodging”
Reviews.Author: tqmman2002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while on a combo business/vacation trip for a week, we found it to be clean and quiet and much better than the hotel circle hotels in same price range. It is convenient to all major highways, and for those that like La Jolla and Del Mar shops/eats it is even better. Do not expect much from the restaurant or the bar, you must have a car to stay here to go get good eats. One good breakfast place around the corner was the Pancake House, also for lunch/dinner or bar food try the 94th Aero Sqaudron.

Reviews.Title: “What you get for the price.”
Reviews.Author: half-life2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points for 2 nights August 19 and 20th, 2005. I gave it an "Above Average" rating because this hotel is above average for the price you pay. Four Points is one of the few 3 star hotels in San Diego with the low nightly rate of $129.00. It is decent and clean. We stayed at a refurbished room on the second floor. It was quiet and everything worked in the room. Our room had a frig and a microwave. Everything in the bathroom worked well. Staff was friendly. No complaints. If you are staying in Four Points San Diego, you should rent a car. The hotel is off the freeway, and with a map, all the attractions are within a 10 minutes drive. No problem if you come prepared. There is a 9-hole golf course on-site here, and the high-speed internet connection in our room worked great. This hotel is catered for the business-traveler. I've stayed at the W San Diego and the Lodge at Torrey Pines. There is nothing exciting about this Four-Points hotel, you get what you paid for. I would stay here again... for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: antonsport
Reviews.Content: Other than the guy who gave me directions to find the place, our stay was a disaster. We booked directly w/ the hotel for 2 nights. When I checked in, they said they only promised one night. The room didn't have the promised pullout couch for my kids. When I asked to switch to another room they did it only after I got confrontational. It took almost an hour to get 2 pillows for the pullout bed. The business office had an old wreck of a computer that had so much spam on it that you couldn't go to google or yahoo with out being hijacked to some random site. The hotel is a wacky setup. It appears to be an old office complex that has been converted into a hotel. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good price /good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely kept and the staff is very nice...I stayed two and half days at this hotel and was very impressed. the rooms are very clean and very comfy....room service was great...the housekeeping staff did not speak english but they were really nice....the rooms and bathrooms are well equipped......also the golf course is soooooooooo nice....restuarnt is a bit pricy but as always....the breakfast is a good deal...an american breakfast for 11 bucks...not bad... i would recommend this to travellers and what is good about this hotel is the complimentary shuttle service to anywhere u want to go within five mile radius....whch is a lot.....would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Four Points Sheraton in San Diego. We had to take a different freeway because of an accident, and when we called the hotel, we got great directions from the front desk clerk. We had requested a room with two beds, non-smoking, and got a room that looked recently renovated. Nice setup with a microwave and Starbucks coffee for the coffeemaker. I loved the pool and fitness area. The fitness room is small, but I was able to use the treadmill while my teenaged daughter swam in the pool. The fitness room has glass walls facing the pool, so you can keep an eye on things from there. We also decided to take advantage of the little golf course, even though we haven't golfed since taking lessond 3 years ago. It was fun to walk the little course before going out to dinner. The hotel really isn't near anything touristy, but it's about 10 minutes, it seems, from everything. There are TONS of great Asian restaurants about 5 minutes away--some of the best in the city, from what I've read. We had a nice breakfast one morning--good food, priced a little high, but typical for a hotel restaurant. The staff in both the restaurant and the front desk were very friendly, as was the driver of the shuttle van. We never used it, but saw the same guy a few times, and he always made it a point to greet us. I've never stayed at a Four Points (usually Sheratons or Westins) but this was a pleasant spot. Lots of corporate travelers there while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: angad76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to major freeways, hence is short drive to downtown San Diego and other major attractions. Staff was really friendly and as requested we were given a renovated room. The rooms were clean and nice with the usual ammenities plus a microwave and a mini fridge. You do get free internet if you use a ethernet cable(can be picked up at the service desk). Wireless internet is for a cost of 9.99 a day. There is no free breakfast in the hotel, but they do have a diner on site. For the price this hotel was a very good deal and offered a pleasent stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 8110 Aero Drive, San Diego, CA 92123
